availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George. W. Booher (Wirt County, WV, & Pendleton County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Wirt County, West Virginia, native. Son of John William Booher and Polly Maise Booher. Married to Martha E. Monroe Booher. Father of Lena E. Booher, Mary A. Booher, John W. Booher, James M. Booher, Martha E. Booher. Laborer in Wirt County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Wirt County in 1860. Signed a petition to Thomas E. Bramlette on behalf of Sobieski W. Clark in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on April 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Wirt County, District 70, p. 75A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Virginia, Wirt County, p. 225.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 368B-369A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Film # 994052: Pendleton County Births, 1877, p. 1 of 4 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA, Film Film 7016145: All Counties: Pendleton County, 1912, File #18272, p. 1776 of 3308 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, “George Washington Booher (1833-1912)," Memorial #46778448, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46778448/george-washington-booher (accessed May 17, 2021).
